data.description: Use, control and administration of centralized and distributed data bases. Topics include the definition, design, creation, revision, interrogation, update, security and integrity of data bases.
data.title: COMPUTER-BASED DATA MANAGEMENT

data.description: Introduction to Data Science programming using Python.  No previous programming experience required.  Emphasis on analyzing real datasets in a variety of forms and visual communication.
data.title: DATA SCIENCE PROGRAMMING I

data.description: Focus is on developing applications and business information systems on the web using a variety of programming languages and tools. Emphasis on deployment as well as design concepts.
data.title: TECHNOLOGY OF COMPUTER-BASED BUSINESS SYSTEMS

data.description: Applied principles and techniques of information systems development including requirements identification and analysis, process and data modeling, team communication and collaboration, and system testing.
data.title: SYSTEMS ANALYSIS AND DESIGN

data.description: An introduction to data analysis procedures covering topics including: data collection, pre-processing, analysis, and presentation. Content covers important data analysis concepts, such as structured and unstructured data. Learn about supervised, unsupervised learning methods and advanced analytics topics, such as text mining, recommendation systems, and algorithm bias.
data.title: DIGITAL PLATFORM ANALYTICS

data.description: Analysis of business systems to identify possible need for new or improved computer-based systems and the design of systems to meet those needs.
data.title: ANALYSIS AND DESIGN OF COMPUTER-BASED SYSTEMS

data.description: Introduction to database management systems with a focus on relational databases. Covers designing, creating, populating, managing, and retrieving data from databases. SQL will be used with a focus on querying for business applications and intelligence, data retrieval for summary reports, and data visualization. Offers a brief introduction to non-relational databases for business applications.
data.title: INTRODUCTION TO DATABASES

data.description: Exploration of subject areas possibly to be introduced into the business curriculum.
data.title: CONTEMPORARY TOPICS

data.description: An introduction to text mining and natural language processing for business applications. Provides an overview of text data and steps to make it usable and approaches for making text data useful in descriptive and predictive analytics applications. Topics include representation approaches, topic modeling, and an overview of key applications of natural language processing, such as chatbots and recommender systems.
data.title: TEXT ANALYTICS AND BUSINESS APPLICATION

data.description: Exploration of subject areas possibly to be introduced into the business curriculum.
data.title: CONTEMPORARY TOPICS

data.description: Focus on the economic and technical concepts behind emerging information systems. Industry cases covering platforms, online markets, artificial intelligence, and business analytics. Caters to interests in technology consulting.
data.title: DIGITAL STRATEGY
